docs.snippet: Alabama’s championship football team is a study in homegrown success, with roughly half of its roster from in-state and the rest overwhelmingly from the Deep South....

docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Football column hods that Alabama’s championship football team is a study in homegrown success, with roughly half of its roster from in-state and the rest overwhelmingly from the Deep South.

headline.seo: Alabama Taps a Talent Pool as Deep as the South

docs.abstract: New York Jets owner Woody Johnson and coach Rex Ryan review the 2012 season during their season-ending news conference; Ryan admits his mistakes and prepares to overhaul his coaching staff for the second time.

docs.snippet: Rob Parker, a panelist on the “First Take” program who was suspended last month for his racially oriented comments about Robert Griffin III, the rookie Redskins quarterback, did not have his contract renewed, ESPN said in a statement....
docs.lead_paragraph: Rob Parker, a panelist on the “First Take” program who was suspended last month for his racially oriented comments about Robert Griffin III, the rookie Redskins quarterback, did not have his contract renewed, ESPN said in a statement.
docs.abstract: ESPN will not renew its contract with commentator Rob Parker, who was suspended for racially oriented comments he made about Washington Redskins quarterback Robert Griffin III.

docs.snippet: Greetings from the capital of shortsightedness, in politics and football....
docs.lead_paragraph: Greetings from the capital of shortsightedness, in politics and football.
docs.abstract: Maureen Dowd Op-Ed column criticizes Washington Redskins coach Mike Shanahan for playing injured quarterback Robert Griffin III; contends decision was similar to decisions made in Congress, which have been focused on short-term gains at expense of long-term solutions.

docs.snippet: CBS, which will broadcast the Super Bowl on Feb. 3, sold all the available commercial time — unless a marketer wants so much to be included that money is no object....
docs.lead_paragraph: CBS, which will broadcast the Super Bowl on Feb. 3, sold all the available commercial time — unless a marketer wants so much to be included that money is no object.
docs.abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column; CBS says that if advertisers are willing to pay premium of up to $6 million, network will find room in its sold out schedule for the Super Bowl broadcast on Feb 3.

headline.seo: A Sellout for Super Bowl Commercial Time
headline.main: Super Bowl Commercial Time Is a Sellout
headline.print_headline: Super Bowl Commercial Time Is a Sellout
